job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Almost 6 weeks pto, many paid holidays, reasonable work load, great problem solving on management side, no micro management at my site
cons: Average pay, not bad,but average

pros: The team seems to care about people and patients, providing good care.
cons: Very busy, heavy caseloads and difficulty getting everything done within the shift.

pros: The pay is good. Some nice co workers. Very interesting work.
cons: Dangerous environment with no security. Training is not up to minimum standards for the field. The building is old with an HVAC system that does not work properly, so that some rooms are as hot as a sauna while others are uncomfortably cold. staff turnover us very high.

pros: The medical and 403b was great benefit!
cons: Leadership wasn’t open to new ideas.

pros: Good hours and easy work
cons: Communication was poor between management and lower employees

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Gods health insurance and PTO
cons: Poor work/life expectations. Managerial skills sub-par.

pros: I love the culture, empowering each other, fair wages, and amazing management.
cons: honestly I am happy so no cons

job_title: School Based Therapist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Market value pay increase, bonus incentives for productivity, flexible schedule, good co-workers.
cons: Unrealistic caseload size and productivity measures, lack of organization in management, lack of creating a culture for employees, constant changes in staff and leadership, under-appreciated, not valued, no interest in growth because of the chaos at the management level.

review_title: Loved helping others, hated how I was treated
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: Working in a field with the ability to help others was great. Other than that, I have nothing else to say.
cons: A LOT of drama. I am glad I left.

review_title: Good pay for first time working at a Behavioral Health
job_title: Direct Care Provider in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
Gain experience in the Behavioral Health 

Learn new skills

Help clients
cons:
More recognition 
Need better communication

review_title: Kick the can mentality with micromanaging.
job_title: BHT case manager in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: Good start to see if this is the field to work in.  Clients are great.  Case Mangers actually care about the client, not the profit.
cons: Non-profit that is profit driven.  Will be told to do an intake knowing they won't qualify for the program because it is "billable".  Communication between departments is almost non-existant.  Coordinators are so busy managing multiple programs with no real support from upstairs.  Home office is in Phoenix so if you aren't there it is difficult to get answers.   No exit interview and anyone above the front line members don't care if you stay.  Don't ever mention coordinating with another behavioral health agency.  The goal is to keep it all in house, not what is best for the client.  No motivation for success because when it is achieved all you get is an "attaboy".  Burn out is high, but hey "we are the largest provider in the state!"  The people that you work with bust their butts but there is no reward.  Actually now when I talk to other agencies and they know where I worked there is always an awkward silence.

review_title: Awesome company to work for and helpful to the community
job_title: IT Applications Analyst in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
-Great IT dept, excellent communication between different teams within IT
-Awesome staff to work with from (bht's, bhmp's, clinicians, etc) 
-Great pay and decent benefits
-Good work/life balance
-Awesome leadership from managers to directors to VP's and CEO!
-Growth opportunities
-Good company outlook and lots of great stuff coming in the future
-Rewarding experience as services really helps those in crisis or substance abuse
(waited my 6th month period to give my review)
cons: -Benefits could be slightly better.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Great benefits especially for domestic partners
cons: Only 2% raise per year no COLA

pros:
You get to work an impactful job that serves the community.

Paid holidays 

Can cash out PTO 

Tuition reimbursement and discounts on LPC masters programs 

Collaborative team environment
cons:
Very heavy workload with borderline disgraceful wages 

Unpredictable workload due to populations served (can occasionally work 12+ hr. shifts without prior warning) 

The executive board and Human Resources department are laughable 

Will pay out of pocket for a large portion of office supplies and sometimes be required to utilize personal phones and computers due to extreme delays in equipment requests.

pros: Amazing teamwork. Clinicians are always willing to help with coverage, providing support, checking in and just being there for one another. It felt like we were a family.
cons: High caseloads, not enough time to do case management and there was a high turnover rate, but it seems like CMH in general is through through this.

pros: Great people to work with.
cons: The pay structure is low.

pros: Great support from supervisors, good company culture, peers are helpful.
cons: Very high caseloads, not much administrative support.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Working here is great since you don't need a lot of experience and there is some room for growth after working a certain amount of time.
cons: Management wasn't great at being available when needed.

job_title: Behavioral Health Professional in Phoenix, AZ
pros: SBH is a great company to work for due to their medical benefits. They also pay for your license renewal and overall want to help the community.
cons: SBH could provide better training passed NEO. At times you feel as though you are expected to know everything and are only trained after you have been doing the work "wrong" for a while.

pros: Decent benefits and good training. Many different position and shift options.
cons: Under qualified management with some micromanaging

pros: Remote work if you're Admin
cons: Too many to count. Anyone of value left the company during the mass migration out in 2018 & those that are there now aren't qualified to work in their capacities. Grossly out of compliance, benefits suck, doesn't care about employees at all, forget it if you are a former employee & need access to your retirement funds, no pto accrual until after 6 months & no bereavement, no jury duty, holidays are day of (ex. no holiday pay on Christmas Eve or New Years Eve). Company brags about it's paid benefits but all the nice perks this company had in the past have been totally eliminated. Doctors and RN's are making less than Admin Directors and most people quit after a month. Nobody wants to stay working here. Low loyalty, high turnover,

pros: Very nice work environment and good people.
cons: No complaints. Love the company.

pros: I liked the people I worked with
cons: The company doesn’t care about you. They want Money from insurance and government. There isn’t even a step process to getting more pay. They take advantage of those that actually want to make a difference. I wouldn’t work here again.

job_title: BHT-behavioral Health Tech in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Decent, pay is good, Big company as far as behavioral health goes
cons: Overworked, not enough training, can be stressful depending on location

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Easy enough and flexible if you are new to working.
cons: Poor pay from the get go, benefits are high, can't keep good employees due to pay, CEO has no clue about what's going on. No incentives, no hazard pay offered at all for for being a direct care worker through whole pandemic, no bonuses ever offered in over 5 years.

pros: overall good management and staff
cons: There are very limited chances of moving up in the company

review_title: Great job helping people in need

cons: Some employees show up for a paycheck and it shows

pros: Some autonomy at first, but things changed.

pros: good management, excellent work aria and great and friendly coworkers.

review_title: Love the flexibility but has its flaws
job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Flexible schedule, great team environment.
cons: Difficulty with integration of PCP services and having enough ancillary medical support staff for providers, EHR has a lot of issues.

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: Nice schedule, mostly good benefits.
cons: Management and HR view you as replaceable. Do not take action when patients threaten employees (it happens, it’s mental health).

pros: nice company culture and free lunch (at times)
cons: low salary and more paperwork than other healthcare agencies

job_title: Case Manager/BHT in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: If your sole purpose is to help people then you can probably deal with all the cons.
cons: Lowest pay for behavioral health in the area. Management is terrible all around. I was subtly bullied the last few months because my coworkers believe we are in high school instead of a professional team. You will never be heard. You are just a number.

job_title: BHT-behavioral Health Tech in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Flexible hours for pool staff
cons: No raises for pool staff

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: I really enjoyed my time working with the patients. Very rewarding experience.
cons: People will need to decide for themselves.

job_title: Junior Network Administrator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: company paid your certs if you pass
cons: out of date technology, need upgrade exchange

review_title: Used to be a great company
pros: Working hours were awesome and I had a great boss
cons: Now after trying to get back to working after a bad accident it seems as though hiring managers won't come out and say it, but they do not like people who are disabled.

review_title: I am a current Behavioral Health Tech at Southwest Behavioral Health.
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Working with our clients can be very rewarding and you can learn a lot from them
cons:
Way to much paperwork. You also have the pressure of productivity. I have seen good people let go for that very reason. If you are at a site where you do not click with your co workers it can be a nightmare. There are sites I refuse to work because of the staff. This company has an almost unhealthy obsession with computers and a disconnect with their employees. There are very few perks to show appreciation of the employees working in the "trenches". Scheduling makes it very difficult to have a private life and upper management does not care. 

Upper management has poor social skills narcissistic and is all about themselves. 

Because of this the company has many employees who feel beat up and are either looking or just going through the motions so they can cope. This is sad as there are many people actively looking for other employment. Heck if I got laid off it would almost be a relief.

pros: Excellent base pay, well-intended staff, provides the coffee (a necessity), benefits and days off are fair compared to other places I've worked. Facilities are being upgraded.
cons: This is the most money oriented non-profit I've ever worked at. Senior management will fail to hold accountable the clients for criminal behavior and have made it known that should murder or violence happen to staff they will NOT help the county to prosecute. There is no staff sense of safety working here. Case Managers will get their own office before a Clinician who has to office share and often gets stuck with tons of case management drowning out the opportunities to do counseling-not a good place to get your licensure requirements completed in a timely manner. Quite frankly, everyday I wonder why I got my Master's since working here.

review_title: There are other fish in the sea...choose one of the others
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Queen Creek, AZ
pros: There are some good staff who really do want to help
cons: Executive management team is a joke. Many, including the CEO, have been with the company for 30+ years and are protected. If you don't stay in line with them, you'll be gone. They'll lay you off and not fill the position for 5-6 months to cover themselves...all just to get rid of someone they see as a problem-child but don't have any sort of documentation to support disciplinary action. This company boasts about its employees being the heart of organization but they're actions suggest anyone (but executive "good 'ol boys") are replaceable.

review_title: Worst company I've ever worked for!!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: If you're truly passionate about healing and helping others through their journey in life... This is a rewarding job.
cons: Lack of diversity inclusion... Lack of employee appreciation... No incentives or bonuses... We didn't even receive Christmas cards from our upper management. Extremely poor, dangerous working conditions. Over worked, poor salary. High turn over. Inconsistent training or lack thereof. Lazy co workers. No team effort. Everyone is overworked and upset because they don't possess the education they need to advance. Major overhaul is needed.

review_title: Not bad but not exciting. Wish supervisor was more appreciative of my work.
pros: Compensation, vacation, 403b, insurance, some people are great to work with
cons: No advancement opportunities in last 4 yrs, some supervisors prefer not to praise the good work their staff do, office politics can sometimes be downright asinine and ridiculous.

pros: This was the most rewarding job I have ever had! I was given the opportunity to assist those with serious illness lead a normal fullfilling life .
cons: The management has no accountability and give those jobs that could possibly put them in a position to be accountable to others- they always assist each other look good. Not their workers, just temperature. It's sad. They can't keep staff.

review_title: Good company, benefits and opportunities for advancement could be better
job_title: Behavioral Health Tech in Phoenix, AZ
pros: SBH is a good ethical company and was able to remain afloat during state budget cuts that threatened this area of service.
cons: Admin is far removed from the stresses and realities of the service sites. Employees don't feel heard when we request better working environment. Feel like "just a number." Also, workers who are in direct care positions need more sick time, because we work with people and therefore get sick! 48 hours per year is not enough, and it does not roll over.

review_title: Fun and challenging with many responsibilities and the opportunity to help others.
pros: Provided counseling to patients and saw progress in treatment plans. Managed all direct care staff at two residential treatment facilities, and enjoyed management. Had the opportunity to utilize my core skill set and see progress.
cons: Paperwork and various administrative duties. Push by company to increase billing and revenue, with less focus on patient care.

pros: The pay could be worse, work with some great people.
cons: Upper management are out of touch and don't trust or value their frontline staff. Very few raises. BHTs are expendable. Always adding more responsibilities to the already unrealistic workload.

pros: Excellent pay and benefits. That's really the only pro, other than the clients are fun to work with.
cons: No concern for clients or the licenses of staff. Not well run or safe.

review_title: Community-based mental health- what else can we say?
pros: Mileage reimbursement, reimbursement for licensure, flexible daily schedule, doable productivity standards
cons: Low pay, charging me for my supervision, constant caveats to perks, low organization within departments. Left hand never knows what the right hand is doing, high turnover, disgruntled employees.

review_title: It's one big happy work family
pros: Every employee supported each other.  I worked in one of the clinics and when I got sick, my supervisor made sure that my work would be taken care of by smmeone else.
cons: The massive amount of paperwork that is neede, especially when they were down of an emlployee.

review_title: Good for beginners bad for long term
pros: Will hire people straight out of school with no field experience, mostly supportive staff, great time off.
cons: Created bad habits and more stress than it was worth. Not enough pay.

job_title: Behavioral Health Professional in Buckeye, AZ
pros: Long history of business within the community. Great system of care to meet the needs of staff and clients.
cons: Very Cliqish. If you are with the in group you are covered if not manages and managers will set you up for failure.

pros: This is a great place to grow. They promote from within, offer extensive training, and really seem to care about the clients and employees.
cons: Pay is a little low and annual merit raises are really low.

pros: Everyone works as a team. Upper management is helpful. The people you work with are fun to work with.
cons: Low pay, expected to work long hours/from home to get notes in on time, the way they do productivity is not fair to Bx Coaches and Case Managers.

job_title: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Counselor in Ocala, FL
pros: Great company to work for.
cons: The cons are few. If you are in a outlining facilitate, you become separate from headquarters, so if any jobs are available in other parts of the company, you might be pass over because individuals don't know you.

review_title: Good for beginners, not for long term.
pros: Decent benefits and PTO. Will hire BHTs right out of school with not experience.
cons: A lot of lazy/burned out staff, low pay, bad management.

job_title: Behavioral Health Professional in Phoenix, AZ
pros: You get to learn a lot. There are a lot of opportunities within the company to switch to.
cons: There should be more training provided when first hired. You are expected to know it all. Things change rather quickly but no one seems to know the answer to anything.

cons: High turn over, no direction or consistency, Company is not favorable for families. No work life balance or flexibility.

pros: company benefits were generally fair, though health insurance could have been better, but employee feedback seemed to be considered on a  regular basis

pros: They appear to be client-centered in their approach to services.

pros: Some of the most incredible people I have ever worked with, open communication with management, and fluidity to make each role your own.

pros: Lots of overtime. If you overwork yourself you can MAYBE get a decent paycheck. Coworkers were supportive and friendly. Clients were appreciative.
